quest.name: Waiting for the Wind to Change
journal: Moghan seems fretful about the weather.

To your frustration, Moghan insists that with the winds blowing as they are, Hraesvelgr is unlikely to be found at Zenith. It would seem you have no choice but to make yourself comfortable, and wait for the weather to turn. Join the moogle in the clearing to the southeast of the wyrm's palace, and inquire if there is anything you can do to make the time pass more quickly.
Alphinaud has left to gather wood for a fire, but Estinien seems concerned by the youth's distracted air. Follow after your fellow Scion, and see that he returns safely.
You have slain the creatures lurking in Alphinaud's vicinity. Return to the clearing, and reassure Estinien that all is well.

You and your companions enjoy the warmth of the crackling campfire, speaking of the road you have traveled, and the lessons you have learned. But though shared adversity has brought you closer together, tensions yet simmer between Estinien and Ysayle. You can only hope that tomorrow's negotiations will bring a final resolution to their─and Ishgard's─conflict...
objectives: Defeat threatening monsters to the west of Alphinaud's location.
Defeat threatening monsters to the east of Alphinaud's location.

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm...we may have a small problem, kupo. When the winds are high like this, Hraesvelgr invariably abandons his lofty perch and heads to the lands below to hunt.

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: If you tried blowing the horn now, I doubt he'd hear it. I suggest we stop at the clearing up ahead and rest until the wind dies down.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The histories make no reference to the existence of these ruins... Curious... Most curious...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Never would I have believed that so much land lay hid above the clouds... Dravania is not as I imagined it.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Do you see that sculpture to the west of here? I am all but certain it was carved in the likeness of Saint Shiva.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The fates make mock of us. To be so close...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Who can say when the weather will turn... I have a mind to make camp.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: And now the very elements conspire to delay our meeting with Hraesvelgr... <sigh> I must be patient.

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: This should do nicely, kupo. The winds will likely have died down by tomorrow, but until then, we might as well make ourselves comfortable!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If we must interrupt our journey so close to its end, I suppose this place is as good as any.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And mayhap a brief respite from the hardships of the road will help to clear our minds in readiness for the coming parley. Very well, then. I believe a campfire is in order.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Leave the gathering of fuel to me─I acquired a keen nose for firewood during my time in the frozen wastes of Coerthas.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hmph. “Clear our minds”? 'Tis Master Alphinaud whose mind needs clearing. The thought of meeting a great wyrm in the flesh has befuddled the boy.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Did you see him stroll away as if these ruins were not crawling with deadly beasts? Follow him, Forename, and see that the wildlife does not make a meal of our young friend.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We will have the camp ready by the time you return.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Master Alphinaud's artless quest for firewood is like to get him killed. I suggest you follow after the boy, and see that no harm comes to him.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Do you see that sculpture to the west of here? I am all but certain it was carved in the likeness of Saint Shiva.

dialogue.name: MOGHAN
dialogue.text: You know, Estinien may not be as bad as I thought, kupo. Under all those horrid spikes, he actually has a soft spot for his companions. Just a small one, mind. Oh, and don't tell him I told you, all right?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Leave the firewood to me!

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: I've prepared some things for a meal. It will be plain fare, but better that than empty bellies.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I see I was right to worry about the boy's safety.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Once Alphinaud returns with the wood, we can see about supper. The ice queen has filled a pot with what looked like stew ingredients, ready for the fire.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ahhh...few things compare to the simple pleasure of sitting beside a crackling campfire of one's own making.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hah! So speaks the “great explorer.” Until recently, you wouldn't have recognized firewood if it came with kindling and a flint.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis well you instructed me so patiently, then! But yes, left to my own devices, I would have been compelled to signal to Ysayle with a pile of damp leaves.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I was born the pampered son of a Sharlayan dignitary, and, alongside my twin, became the youngest student ever to be accepted into the Studium.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: How proud I was to match wits with scholars and philosophers... How ignorant of mine own shortcomings... That hubris invited manipulation and betrayal...and led to the downfall of the Scions.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: We all of us are guilty of similar ignorance. How many men lay down their lives, never knowing what it is that they fight for? Never questioning that which they have been taught to believe?

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: 'Twas only upon meeting Hraesvelgr that I learned the truth hidden within our history. Were it not for that chance encounter, I would never have vowed to tear down the Holy See, and expunge the falsehoods with which it fans the flames of conflict. I would have lived and died in ignorance. That the truth has driven me to do terrible things, I cannot deny, but I would rather sin in the pursuit of peace than imagine myself virtuous for perpetuating a needless war.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If this journey has taught me anything, it is the importance─and difficulty─of holding to one's convictions in the face of failure...of striving always to replace one's ignorance with knowledge.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You are well on your way, Master Alphinaud. At your age, I was but a fool swinging a spear, with scarcely a thought in my head.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Even now, I struggle to acknowledge the misconceptions under which I have labored.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Sitting here, amongst these grand ruins, how can I deny that man and dragon once lived in peace?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But for all that such an age existed, we are now in a time of war. Nidhogg killed my family, and no quirk of history will exonerate him.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I may be ignorant of how the Dragonsong War began, but if we do not put an end to this conflict now, I can say for a certainty that it will only breed more vengeful souls such as mine.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: In my hands resides the power to vanquish a great wyrm. If Ishgard's survival rests on me wielding that power, I will slay Nidhogg myself...orders or no.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Estinien... You gave your word...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: My word is contingent upon the success of our parley. Show me the strength of your convictions, Lady Iceheart. Convince Hraesvelgr of the righteousness of your cause.

dialogue.name: ICEHEART
dialogue.text: Doubt not but that I shall, dragoon.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well...winds willing, we shall have our answers on the morrow. Let us sleep now, and face our fate with the rising of the sun...
